isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - DIGITAL MULTIMETER USE - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubproc.title: Verify the Problem
svcsubproc.para: Operate the complete system and list all symptoms as follows:

item.para: Check the accuracy and completeness of the complaint.
Learn more that might give a clue to the nature and location of the problem.
Analyze what parts of the system are working.

svcsubproc.title: Read Electrical Operation
svcsubproc.para: Read the electrical operation for the problem circuit and review the circuit diagram. Understanding electrical operation and the circuit diagram can narrow the cause of the problem to one component or parts the circuit.

svcsubproc.title: Check the Circuit Diagram
svcsubproc.para: See the circuit diagram for possible clues to the problem. Location of specific components in the circuit will help identify the source of the problem.

Circuit diagrams are designed to make it easy to identify common points in circuits. This helps to narrow the problem to a specific area. For example, if several circuits fail at the same time, check for a common power source or common ground connection (see POWER DISTRIBUTION AND GROUNDS). If part of a circuit fails, check the connections between the part that works and the part that does not work.

For example, if the low-beam headlights work, but both high-beam lights and the high-beam indicator do not work, the power and ground paths must be good. Since the dimmer switch is the component that switches the power to the high-beam headlights, it is probably the cause of failure.

svcsubproc.title: Check the Cause of the Problem
svcsubproc.para: Diagnosis charts identify many common faults that may occur. Refer to these charts in each section. Follow the procedures in the chart until the cause of the problem is located.
If a particular symptom found in the problem circuit is not covered by a diagnosis chart, see Electrical Test Equipment below.

svcsubproc.title: Make the Repair
svcsubproc.para: Repair the problem circuit as directed in the diagnostic charts.

svcsubproc.title: Verify that the Repair is Complete
svcsubproc.para: Operate the system, check that the repair has removed all symptoms, and that the repair has not caused new symptoms.

svcsubproc.title: Electrical Test Equipment
svcsubproc.para: The Fluke 88™ uses very little current. The digital meter has a high impedance (resistance) of 10 megaohms (10 MΩ).
